title: Cyberslacking Simulation – SWG Audit
description: Test perimeter category and URL policy. YouTube category links only. Blocked = perimeter passed; allowed = perimeter may not enforce restrictions.
keywords: SWG Audit, cyberslacking test, category policy, URL policy, YouTube, perimeter security
headline: Validate the real-world effectiveness of your perimeter security against Cyberslacking
subline: This simulation tests category and URL policy?Rules that control access to websites based on their classification (social media, entertainment, news) or specific URLs. Enforced by the SWG to prevent non-work-related browsing. at the perimeter (SWG?Secure Web Gateway — a security solution that filters web traffic, enforces policies, and protects against web-based threats in real-time.), not endpoint or device controls. Simulation uses YouTube only. When the SWG blocks non‑productive categories?Web content classified as entertainment, gaming, sports, or other time-wasting activities that reduce workplace productivity. SWGs use category databases to classify URLs automatically., some links will be blocked. All links load = perimeter may not enforce video‑level restrictions. Run from a device that routes through the perimeter under test.
